oai_dc:dc.dc:title: McCammon Diary
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Samuel McCammon
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Transcription of the Diary of Samuel McCammon (1801-1860), son of John and Elizabeth Upton McCammon. The diary covers January 1, 1846 through December 31, 1854. It was written while living on his farm in what is now a portion of Knoxville. The McClung Historical Collection owns the original diary. This transcription was done in 1940 and includes an index at the back (scans 192-211). The writer of this diary, Samuel McCammon (1801-1860), was a first cousin of the Samuel McCammon who was Sheriff from 1838-1850 in Knox County, Tennessee.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Diaries;
